image.altText: Jacinta Price speaks while Dutton stands behind her listening.

props.synopsis: NT Labor has claimed Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price’s defection was driven by "ego" while a long-time politics watcher has labelled the move a "considerable gamble".

title.children: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's defection a 'considerable gamble'

image.altText: Aerial shot of Alice Springs township, 2019.

props.synopsis: Police have charged the 28-year-old with a series of child abuse offences, including one count of sexual intercourse with a child under 10, following a search at an Alice Springs home.

title.children: Man charged in Alice Springs over alleged rape of child following FBI tip-off

image.altText: Man drives boat on river with fishing rods above head

props.synopsis: Bill Yan is volunteering as chief marshal at the five-day Barramundi Classic on the Daly River, but has not taken leave from his ministerial role.

title.children: NT treasurer spends week before first budget at fishing comp

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing a black graphic tee, with gray hair, speaking at a podium in front of a Garma festival banner.

props.synopsis: Arnhem Land leader Mr B Yunupiŋu will be remembered as a softly spoken man of honour and wisdom, after his death following an alleged attack in his home community.

title.children: Garma Festival ceremonial leader B Yunupiŋu dies after alleged violent attack

image.altText: ADF and Port of Darwin workers rearm Australian, Canadian and US Warships at Port of Darwin 2024 Credit ADF

props.synopsis: Experts say the inclusion of new destinations for United States military cargo shipments, and their increasing lethality, marks a shift in US posturing in Australia and the Indo-Pacific region.

title.children: US expected to ship 'radioactive' materials to Australian ports in arms expansion

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: A mourner of grocer Linford Feick, who was fatally stabbed last month, was taken to hospital with an eye injury after being struck by a brick thrown from a moving car.

title.children: Slain NT grocer funeral guest hit by brick allegedly thrown at car

image.altText: Two men on a boat, both wearing light blue hoodies and holding fishing rods.

props.synopsis: About 150 competitive anglers travel to Daly River for the annual Barramundi Classic.

title.children: Iconic fishing competition draws anglers to the NT's remote Daly River

image.altText: A coast beachside, palm trees, bitumen walking and cycling path. Shirtless cyclist in sight, along with people walking.

props.synopsis: NT police have charged a teenage boy in relation to six separate incidents that allegedly involved the indecent assault of women at a popular Darwin walking spot and local hospital car park.

title.children: Boy charged over series of indecent assaults at popular walking spot

image.altText: A very tight close up of an Aboriginal woman's face, blonde hair holding a serious but relaxed expression. Background blurred

props.synopsis: Overcrowding, poor access to healthcare, and antisocial behaviour in remote NT communities is pushing people into city centres. Once they arrive, it can be a cycle of temporary accommodation and homelessness.

title.children: Declining living standards in remote NT forces many into homelessness

image.altText: Aerial view of Orange in NSW.

props.synopsis: A country town famous for its food and wine is now positioning itself as an innovation and agricultural technology hub, with a growing number of entrepreneurs basing themselves here.

title.children: 'Next Canva or Atlassian': Orange is looking to realise dreams of business grandeur

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair sitting at her home office.

props.synopsis: Labor recorded a landslide victory in last Saturday's federal election, while the Coalition and Greens lost seats in the House of Representatives. Here's how some Australians changed their vote, some for the first time.

title.children: The Coalition had a problem with all women, polling expert says

image.altText: Greg Thompson stands on a paved area in front of hedges with his hands in his pockets and a sullen look on his face..

props.synopsis: When Greg Thompson became bishop of Newcastle, he refused to turn a blind eye to the decades-long child sex abuse scandals in the diocese. For him, it was personal. He was himself a sexual abuse survivor. But speaking out came at huge cost.

title.children: The Anglican bishop who took on sexual abuse in the church

image.altText: A group of soldiers raise arms in air to officers standing on a tank.

props.synopsis: India and Pakistan have boosted their military capabilities since they clashed in 2019. As tensions rise between the nuclear-armed neighbours, this is how they stack up.

title.children: How India and Pakistan's military and nuclear capabilities compare

image.altText: Illustration showing pieces of a puzzle with the letter W and three figures pushing puzzle pieces into place

props.synopsis: In an age of polarisation and AI, the free online encyclopedia's very existence could be at stake.

title.children: Why Trump and his allies have Wikipedia in their sights

image.altText: albanese clean energy

props.synopsis: Hydrogen is not dead, and Labor's historic victory could change the global energy trade, economist Ross Garnaut says.

title.children: Economist says Labor's victory could change global energy trade

image.altText: A white woman with long brown hair standing in a park|

props.synopsis: Ali France's election win over Peter Dutton isn't just a positive for Anthony Albanese and Labor — it's also big for the disability community, writes Nas Campanella.

title.children: Ali France's election win is big for the disability community

image.altText: A woman in a bright red sweater and blue jeans texts on her smartphone

props.synopsis: I may be the last person on earth to be personally confronted by the potential of AI technology. I knew it would come for our jobs. But I didn't expect it might come for our hearts.

title.children: I knew AI was coming for my job. I wasn't prepared for it to come for my heart

image.altText: Pope Leo is seen from behind praying over a grave marked "Franciscus". It's indoors and there are two white roses on the grave

props.synopsis: Pope Leo XIV speaks of the challenges posed by AI in his first official address to church leaders, before making a surprise visit to his predecessor’s grave.

title.children: Pope Leo warns of AI challenges before unexpected visit to Francis's grave

image.altText: Two booking photos provided by the California Department of Corrections shows Erik Menendez, left, and Lyle Menendez.

props.synopsis: Re-sentencing hearings for Erik and Lyle Menendez, who have spent 35 years in prison for killing their parents, are set to move forward in the US next week.

title.children: Menendez brothers resentencing set for next week

image.altText: tight photo of vietnamese pork roll

props.synopsis: The bánh mi was created in Vietnam after the arrival of French colonialists. Now it's a firm favourite for lunch across Australia.

title.children: Why are Australians so obsessed with bánh mi?

image.altText: A composite of Australian cash with lady gaga

props.synopsis: A new Lady Gaga album, knee-high Converse and Snooki at the club. According to social media, signs of a recession are everywhere.

title.children: Lady Gaga and high-top Converse. Recession indicators are all around

image.altText: A screenshot of gambling videos being played on the AFL website.

props.synopsis: A self-exclusion gambling toggle on the AFL website does not stop users from seeing match odds, with one user calling the feature "tokenistic".

title.children: Betting odds still visible on AFL website after opting out

image.altText: Sussan Ley wearing a black blazer, shot from below with a big smile looking to the right

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley hopes to be the first female leader of the Liberal Party. But can she afford to take her eye off her electorate in the process?

title.children: Ley's leadership push met with mixed response in home electorate

image.altText: A man thanks the crowd after a rugby league match

props.synopsis: He set an NRL record in his debut year that might never be broken, but 20 years after his incredible rookie season, Tim Smith knows the long game is more important.

title.children: The NRL's greatest rookie has no regrets despite watching his peers eclipse him

image.altText: Tennis player Jannik Sinner looks down with lights behind him.

props.synopsis: After three months out due to a doping ban, world number one Jannik Sinner is embraced by adoring fans at the Rome Masters, where Alex de Minaur also wins through.

title.children: Italian crowd compares Sinner's victorious return to pope's ascent

image.altText: china trade talks

props.synopsis: Talks between the United States and China aimed at easing their potentially devastating battles over trade will continue on Sunday in Geneva.

title.children: China, US meet in Geneva to discuss trade tariffs

image.altText: Two 18-year-old teenage men standing in court.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers have been sentenced after they were found with about 5,000 ants in their possession. While they claim it was an innocent hobby, Kenyan Wildlife officers say different.

title.children: Teen 'hobbyists' caught with 5,000 ants sentenced over wildlife smuggling

image.altText: plane on runway

props.synopsis: Yet another Pacific airline is facing the prospect of going under, with Tonga's national carrier Lulutai Airlines this week searching for partners to help keep it afloat.

title.children: Safety concerns and lack of planes put Pacific airline in danger of collapse

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: It's time to prove your worth.

title.children: Do you like your Sunday quiz with a serving of sass? Let’s play … HARD!

image.altText: An effigy of the Philippine president fights with one of the vice president

props.synopsis: Death threats and alleged crimes against humanity loom over the Philippines midterm elections, but in Australia the diaspora community is excited about online voting and Filipino democracy sausages.

title.children: Vote of Filipinos in Australia could help seal fate of Duterte dynasty

image.altText: A woman stands at a doorway looking out.

props.synopsis: Long-time resident Narelle Lockett has left the area because she couldn't find an affordable place to live. Despite the region's housing crisis, multiple developments are being put on pause or knocked back.

title.children: After 40 years calling the Sunshine Coast home, Narelle has been forced out

image.altText: Bags of cocaine

props.synopsis: Five men are charged after police allegedly found more than 1,000 bricks of cocaine, weighing just over a tonne in total, on a boat off the coast of Nambucca Heads.

title.children: Cash purchase of boat leads to $600m cocaine haul by NSW Police

image.altText: Melina Vidler, Albert Mwangi and Marta Dusseldorp sit in a car and look off-camera in a film still.

props.synopsis: From the mother-daughter bond to the romantic, With or Without You explores love in all its forms.

title.children: This filmmaker's marriage was ending. Naturally, she wrote a love story

image.altText: Project:herSELF founder Tahlia Isaac.

props.synopsis: With Australia's female prison population on the rise, Tahlia Isaac is using her own journey to help other women rebuild after prison.

title.children: A woman who was incarcerated is helping others escape a cycle of crime

image.altText: An aerial view of an old country primary school turned family home

props.synopsis: An agent says interest in alternatives to traditional real estate is on the rise in regional Australia, due in part to the nation's housing crisis.

title.children: Fun park, police station and school transformed into 'quirky' homes
